column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15340](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15340.html) (gui: Introduce bilingual GUI error messages
Ok I've tested and it does abort if invalid, and issues a warning if fee is too high.
Maybe move it up to around line 1099, to sit alongside the other fee-related options handling?
> Maybe move it up to around line 1099, to sit alongside the other fee-related options handling?\n\ndone
Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits. There is no need to keep the git history around in this pull request.

utACK dfbf117bbb82c76c8cb60dba73ae7d653e3b8348 because it at least makes behaviour consistent. I still don't think that `-maxtxfee` should be shared between the node and wallet, so this doesn't fully address my concerns in #15355. Reasoning here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15355#issuecomment-461816523.

ACK dfbf117bbb82c76c8cb60dba73ae7d653e3b8348.

Checked that it is no longer ignored when the wallet is not compiled or not enabled:

```
$ ./configure --disable-wallet && make
$ ./src/qt/bitcoin-qt -maxtxfee=foobar
Error: Invalid amount for -maxtxfee=<amount>: 'foobar'

$ ./configure && make
$ ./src/qt/bitcoin-qt -maxtxfee=foobar -disablewallet
Error: Invalid amount for -maxt

`return InitError` has been changed to just `InitError` here so I think this changes behavior.\n\nMaybe this code should move to the `AppInitParameterInterfaction` function instead of `InitParameterInterfaction` to avoid needing this change.

I wasn't sure about that, but `WalletInit::ParameterInteraction` returned a bool and `InitParameterInteraction` returns void, so I removed it. `InitParameterInteraction` looks like it will work, though.
> looks like it will work\n\nDid you test that the initialization is aborted when you supply an invalid maxtxfee?

> Did you test that the initialization is aborted when you supply an invalid maxtxfee?\n\nIt will not abort unless it returns. I'll move it to `AppInitParameterInteraction` so it can return and abort.
